isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - DESCRIPTION - Engine Protection Systems

svcsubproc.title: Standard Engine Protection System
svcsubproc.para: CELECT PLUS engines are equipped with an engine protection system as a standard feature. This feature includes the "red" Oil/Water Warning Light (referred to in Cummins literature as an Engine Protection Light). This system monitors important engine parameters and logs diagnostic faults when an over-or under-normal operating range condition occurs. The engine protection also derates engine torque and engine speed when certain engine fluid parameters pass a limit point.
The ECM also logs the time of the occurrence and other relevant information. This data can be read using an Electronic Service Tool (EST).

The red Oil/Water Warning Light will turn on at the occurrence then begin blinking after a period of time. This blinking operation is to warn the driver that the condition has been active for a period of time or else the pressure or temperature condition has become worse.The Engine Protection system monitors:
With the key on and engine off and with the Diagnostic switch off, the Oil/Water Light will come on for two seconds and then turn off as a system test.

svcsubproc.title: CELECT Engine Protection Shutdown
svcsubproc.para: This system is customer selectable and can be enabled using Electronic Service Tools (EST). This system will shut down the engine whenever monitored parameters fall outside the operating range.

The engine protection shutdown is triggered when the red Oil/Water Warning Light starts flashing for the current engine protection/ warning derate. Once triggered, the engine will shut down after 30 seconds.
During the 30 second warning period, the standard torque and speed derates will occur.

The engine can be restarted by cycling the key switch. After the engine is restarted, it will be limited to the maximum torque and/or speed derate levels of the out-of-range parameter, if the engine protection fault is still active.
If an engine protection fault goes inactive during the 30 second shutdown warning period, the engine will return to normal operation and will not shut down.
With the key on and engine off and with the Diagnostic switch off, the Oil/Water Light will come on for two seconds and then turn off as a system test.
